results.title: The Grapes of Wrath
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Darryl F. Zanuck, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Adaptation of John Steinbeck’s famous novel. The dramatic story of the Joad family and their migration to California from their dust-bowl farm in Oklahoma during the Depression. An observance of America during a difficult era, the film reveals considerable compassion for poor, honest people struggling for dignity against seemingly insurmountable odds. Stars Henry Fonda, Jane Darwell, John Carradine and Charley Grapewin.

results.title: The Graduate (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Turman, Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), Lawrence Turman Inc and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: Mentally adrift after graduating from college, Benjamin Braddock is pressured by both family and friends to take on the responsibilities of adulthood, namely to marry and find a job. But the exhortation of family friend, Mr. Robinson, to seize every possible opportunity inspires Ben to accept Mrs. Robinson’s offers of sex. Shortly after, Ben is pushed into dating the Robinsons’ daughter, Elaine, and after falling in love with her he finds himself in the compromising position of maintaining a relationship with both women. Also includes a 45 min. documentary on the making of the film. Cast includes: Dustin Hoffman, Anne Bancroft, Katherine Ross, William Daniels, Elizabeth Wilson and Murray Hamilton.

results.title: The Graduate
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Lawrence Turman, Lawrence Turman Inc and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Dustin Hoffman stars as college graduate Benjamin Braddock, who spends his first summer out of school being seduced by the wife of his father’s best friend. He also falls in love with the woman’s daughter to further complicate his life. Nominated for 7 Academy Awards, The Graduate won the Oscar for Best Direction, (Mike Nichols), and its brilliant score by Simon and Garfunkle won 3 Grammies. Ann Bancroft is the memorable Mrs. Robinson, with Katherine Ross as her daughter and rival for Benjamin’s affection. “The Graduate” is a modern comedy classic to be enjoyed again and again.

results.title: The Goonies
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Harvey Bernhard and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: When a group of greedy developers decide to demolish the headquarters of the Goonies- a group of adventurous youngsters, it seems that the gang will have to disband. By pure coincidence they they encounter a 17th century pirate map and set out on an adventure to locate the treasure and raise the necessary money to save the property. It quickly becomes apparent that they aren’t the only people interested in the treasure, when they cross paths with a group of criminals. The Goonies start to live up to their adventurous mission more than ever when they enter a fabulous subterranean world and are forced into a series of events that could mean the difference between life, death, and the future of their home. Cast includes Sean Astin, Josh Brolin, Jeff Cohen, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton.

results.title: The Good Earth
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Irving G. Thalberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in pre-revolutionary China, Paul Muni plays Wang Lung, a simple peasant farmer who rises to become a prosperous lord. Tragedy pursues him as he betrays his family and neglects the earth he has worshipped. Luise Rainer won an Academy Award for her portrayal of O-Lan, Wang’s devoted wife, a battered slave who grows into a proud, loyal woman. Based on Pearl S. Buck’s Pulitzer Prize winning novel.

constellations_other.name: Legacy of an icon: Anna May Wong
constellations_other.description: Wong Liu Tsong, known professionally as Anna May Wong, was a film star in the 1920s and 30s who made a career for herself despite racist stereotypes and vilification. Her legacy lives on as she is now being portrayed by contemporary actors on film and TV.

results.title: The Golden Louis
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: A tale of choice between a gambler’s need and his pity for a young homeless girl. Cast includes Anita Hendrie, Adele DeGarde, Owen Moore, Charles Inslee, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Gold Rush (1925)
results.brief_description: The Gold Rush, an immortal classic, is regarded as one of Chaplin’s very best films, interweaving to brilliant effect the pathetic tale of the Tramp’s apparently hopeless love for a dancehall girl with the funny story of the Tramp and his burly gold prospecting partner heading off to make their fortunes in the great Yukon gold rush. Through the entire film hangs Chaplin’s finely perceived view of the contrast between the Tramp’s selfless, humanitarian behaviour, and the unpleasant, brutish life of the gold town society. Rated: G

results.title: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Fred Kohlmar and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Lucy Muir (Gene Tierney) a beautiful widow and her daughter (Natalie Wood) rent a house by the ocean, and refuse to be frightened by the former owner’s ghost, a dashing sea captain (Rex Harrison). When her income suddenly stops, he suggests that they collaborate on a book about his life and the unlikely pair fall deeply in love. Then Lucy’s affection is challenged by a live man (George Sanders), leaving the broken-hearted captain to choose another course. Acclaimed for its heartwarming screenplay and Oscar-nominated cinematography, this film is a moving, sentimental Hollywood classic.

results.title: The Getting of Wisdom
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Phillip Adams, Australian Film Commission and Southern Cross Film Productions
results.brief_description: Laura Tweedle Ramsbotham is about to enter another world. From her home in sleepy, rural Australia she ascends to the dreaming spires of an exclusive college for young ladies, a very strict Victorian boarding school in Melbourne. Laura (Susannah Fowles) is strong willed and rebellious, which creates conflict with her peers and her teachers. In a desperate attempt to find acceptance with her peers, she weaves the most lurid yarns imaginable. The only real soulmate she finds is one of the senior girls. The novel by Henry Handel Richardson was published in 1910, and was so shocking at the time that the author’s name (Ethel Richardson) was stricken from the records of the school in which she set the thinly-disguised autobiography. An amusing and sometimes touching story which features an excellent performance from Barry Humphries as the repressed fire and brimstone minister. Also stars John Waters, Sheila Helpman, Patricia Kennedy and Julie Blake.

results.title: The Full Monty
results.creator_credit: Peter Cattaneo, Uberto Pasolini and Redwave Productions
results.brief_description:
Robert Carlyle stars as Gaz in this irreverent comedy set in the middle-England working class town of Sheffield. He is a jobless steel worker who dreams up an outrageous scheme to pull himself and his mates out of the personal and financial doldrums of long term unemployment. After seeing the money and adulation lauded upon the male exotic dance team The Chippendales by the females of the town, he rounds up willing and reticent participants for a review to be named the Full Monty. They are a collection of pigeon-chested, pot-bellied, heavy drinking, pale, wrinkly middle-aged strippers with one solitary gimmick - it all comes off!
Cast also includes: Tom Wilkinson, Mark Addy
